title: Week 1: Introduction to Reinforcement Learning
description: Overview of RL concepts, history, and applications, focusing on foundational principles.

title: Week 2: Markov Decision Processes (MDPs)
description: Exploration of MDP formulation and value functions, detailing their significance in reinforcement learning.

title: Week 3: Dynamic Programming
description: Study of policy evaluation and improvement, including policy iteration and its applications in RL.

title: Week 4: Monte Carlo Methods
description: Introduction to Monte Carlo prediction and control, emphasizing hands-on implementation in RL contexts.

title: Week 5: Temporal Difference Learning
description: Comparative analysis of SARSA and Q-learning, focusing on the distinction between on-policy and off-policy learning.

title: Week 6: Function Approximation
description: Investigation of linear vs. non-linear function approximation, with applications in value-based methods.

title: Week 7: Generalization in Reinforcement Learning
description: Analysis of overfitting, capacity, and sample complexity challenges in reinforcement learning settings.

title: Week 8: Policy Gradient Methods
description: Study of the REINFORCE algorithm and actor-critic methods, applying policy gradient techniques in RL.

title: Week 9: Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
description: Examination of cooperation vs. competition in multi-agent systems and the strategies involved in such environments.

title: Week 10: Deep Reinforcement Learning
description: Understanding Deep Q-Networks (DQN) and the balance between exploration and exploitation in deep learning applications.

title: Week 11: Applications of RL in Robotics
description: Focus on learning control policies for robotic systems through the implementation of RL algorithms.

title: Week 12: Applications of RL in Healthcare
description: Analysis of personalized treatment and optimization in healthcare, exploring real-world problems addressed by RL.

title: Week 13: Ethics in AI and RL
description: Discussion of the ethical implications of AI, including fairness and transparency in the context of reinforcement learning.

title: Week 14: Final Project Preparation
description: Collaboration and preparation for final project presentations, focusing on research outcomes and communication.

title: Week 15: Student Research Presentations
description: Presentation of independent research projects, effectively communicating findings and receiving peer feedback.
